</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Audit Fees:</font></b></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The
aggregate amount noted above for Audit Fees includes fees for the audit of the
Company&#146;s financial statements, reviews of the Company&#146;s quarterly financial
statements (including restatement filings), attestation of management&#146;s
assessment of internal control, as required by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of
2002, Section&nbsp;404 and comfort letters, consents and other services related
to Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) matters. The amount billed by
Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche for work that was required to be performed this year
in connection with Sarbanes-Oxley Section&nbsp;404 requirements totaled
$4,068,973.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Audit Related Fees:</font></b></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The aggregate
amount noted above for Audit Related Fees includes fees for accounting
consultations (internal control testing) and audits of employee benefit plans.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Tax Fees:</font></b></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The aggregate amount
noted above for tax fees includes fees for corporate and subsidiary tax return
preparation services, corporate tax consultation, expatriate tax return
preparation services and consultations.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">All Other Fees:</font></b></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The aggregate
amount noted above for All Other Fees includes fees for permitted non-audit
services and consisted of miscellaneous projects.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Total Fees:</font></b></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The
amount of Total Fees excludes fees billed to equity method investees in both
years. The Company desired to maintain an independent relationship between
itself and Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche, and to ensure that level of independence
during 2005, the Audit Committee maintained its policy established in 2002
within which to judge if Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche may be eligible to provide
certain services outside of its main role as outside auditor. Services within
the established framework include audit and related services and certain tax
services. Services outside of the framework require Audit Committee approval
prior to the performance of the service. This framework is consistent with the
provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act which address auditor independence.
All audit and non-audit services provided to the Company by Deloitte&nbsp;&amp;
Touche during 2005 were pre-approved by the Audit Committee, except in the case
of certain de minimus non-audit services as permitted by Section&nbsp;10A(i)(B)&nbsp;of
the Securities Exchange Act. Specifically, during 2005, fees for tax services
totaling $590 were approved under the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">de
minimis</font></i> provision. The Board, acting through the Audit Committee,
has resolved to phase out the use of the Company&#146;s independent auditor for
Company tax services.</p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

 <tr>
  <td width="100%" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><a name="SecurityOwnershipOfCertainBenefic_131941"></a><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF
  CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS,<br>
  DIRECTORS, AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The following table sets forth the beneficial
ownership of the Company&#146;s Common Stock by (a)&nbsp;each Director and named
executive officer, (b)&nbsp;all Directors and executive officers as a group and
(c)&nbsp;all persons known by the Company to own more than five percent (5%) of
the Company&#146;s Common Stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. Unless otherwise
indicated, each of the persons and group listed below has sole voting and
dispositive power with respect to the shares shown.</font></p>

  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">

  </td>

  </td>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shares held
represent less than 1% of the total number of outstanding shares of Common
Stock of the Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:10.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(13)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Of

 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">18</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><a name="ReportOfTheCompensationCommitteeO_043332"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="100%" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">REPORT
  OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ON<br>
  EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
responsibilities of the Compensation Committee of the Board include
establishing policies governing the compensation of executive officers of AES.
The Compensation Committee is composed of three Directors that satisfy the &#147;independence&#148;
standards of the NYSE and the Sarbanes-Oxley Act. The Compensation
Committee operates under a written charter adopted by the Board. A copy of the
charter is available on the AES website at www.aes.com.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="CompensationPhilosophy_043355"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Compensation Philosophy</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee&#146;s principal objective in establishing compensation and
benefit policies is to develop and administer a comprehensive program designed
to attract, motivate and retain outstanding people. The policies are designed
to create a strong link between performance and pay, while encouraging people
to make career commitments to AES and to accomplish AES&#146;s short and long-term
business objectives.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee&#146;s guidelines for compensation of executive officers are
designed to provide fair and competitive levels of total compensation, while
linking pay with performance. Executive officers are evaluated annually on both
performance according to individual responsibilities and contributions, and
broader measures related to corporate performance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">There are three
elements of AES executive officer compensation: Base Salary, Annual Bonus, and
Long-Term Compensation. The Compensation Committee&#146;s guideline for each
component of compensation is to provide compensation that is generally
consistent with the Compensation Committee&#146;s interpretation of competitive
compensation for individuals with similar responsibilities at companies with
similar financial and operating characteristics. Comparisons are made with
published data, where available, and various industry-sponsored
compensation surveys. In addition, consultants review our benchmark data
periodically. Because individual compensation is determined in part by
experience and performance, actual compensation may vary from industry averages.
&#160;Executive officers are also eligible for
profit sharing, as described in more detail below.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="GeneralbaseSalary_043400"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">General/Base Salary</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Base Salary is
reviewed annually by the Compensation Committee to determine if adjustments are
appropriate to reflect performance as well as changes in the general economy
and cost of living. In addition, adjustments are made periodically to recognize
significant changes in the responsibilities of individual executive officers.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="AnnualBonus_043405"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Annual Bonus</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amounts of
annual bonuses awarded in 2005 were based 40&nbsp;percent on meeting cash flow
targets, 25&nbsp;percent on meeting performance improvement targets,
25&nbsp;percent on the achievement of individual objectives, and 10 percent on
safety performance. Targeted ranges for the annual bonus for different officer
job categories or functions were determined using benchmark industry data.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Company
sponsors and maintains the AES Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;Incentive Plan&#148;),
an annual incentive bonus program designed to provide incentives to key
employees with significant responsibility for achieving performance goals
critical to the success and growth of the Company.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">19</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In light of
recent changes to the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Code&#148;), including The
American Jobs Creation Act of 2004, and to further enhance the provisions of
the Incentive Plan, the Company has determined that it is advisable to codify
the current Incentive Plan to ensure clarity and avoid any subsequent questions
regarding the past or future intent of the Incentive Plan. In addition, the
Company seeks to ensure that the Incentive Plan complies with Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of
the Code, which allows for deductibility of certain executive compensation in
excess of $1million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Incentive
Plan rewards key employees with significant responsibility for achieving
performance goals critical to the success and growth of the Company. The Plan
is designed to: (i)&nbsp;promote the attainment of the Company&#146;s significant
business objectives; (ii)&nbsp;encourage and reward management teamwork across
the entire Company; and (iii)&nbsp;assist in the attraction and retention of
employees vital to the Company&#146;s long-term success.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amount of a
Participant&#146;s award may be based on a percentage of such Participant&#146;s salary
or such other methods as may be established by the Compensation Committee. Each
award shall be communicated to the Participant, and shall specify, among other
things, the terms and conditions of the award and the performance goals to be
achieved. Each award shall be conditioned upon the Company&#146;s achievement of one
or more performance goal(s)&nbsp;with respect to the performance measure(s)&nbsp;established
by the Compensation Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">After the end
of each calendar year (the &#147;Performance Period&#148;), the Compensation Committee
shall certify in writing the extent to which the applicable performance goals
and any other material terms have been achieved. Subject to the provisions of the
Incentive Plan, earned Awards shall be paid in the first calendar year
immediately following the end of the Performance Period (it being the Company&#146;s
intention that any such payments will be made on or before March&nbsp;15 of
such calendar year in order to qualify for the short-term deferral exception
under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Executive
officers also participate in the Company&#146;s profit sharing under The AES
Corporation Retirement Savings Plan (the &#147;Retirement Plan&#148;) on the same terms
as all other participants in the Retirement Plan, subject to any legal
limitations on amounts that may be contributed to or benefits that may be
payable under the Retirement Plan. Matching contributions and annual profit
sharing contributions are made with AES Common Stock to better align the
recipient&#146;s interests with that of the Stockholders and to encourage long-term
performance. In addition, certain employees of the Company participate in the
Company&#146;s Restoration Supplemental Retirement Plan, which provides supplemental
retirement benefits to &#147;highly compensated employees&#148; as defined in the Code of
an amount that would be contributed on such individual&#146;s behalf under the
Retirement Plan but is not so contributed because of the limitations contained
in the Code.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In most cases,
the Compensation Committee has taken steps to qualify income paid to any
executive officer as a deductible business expense pursuant to regulations
issued by the Internal Revenue Service under Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the
Code with respect to qualifying compensation paid to executive officers in
excess of $1 million. The Compensation Committee will continue to consider the
implications to the Company of qualifying all compensation as a deductible
expense under Section&nbsp;162(m), but retains the discretion to pay bonuses
commensurate with an executive officer&#146;s contributions to the success of the
Company irrespective of whether such amounts are fully deductible.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="TheAesCorporation2003LongtermComp_043411"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The AES Corporation 2003 Long Term
Compensation Plan</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Company
provides a strong link between pay and performance by tying a portion of
executive compensation under The AES Corporation&nbsp; 2003 Long Term
Compensation Plan (&#147;2003 LTC Plan&#148;) to long term AES </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">business
performance and a portion to stock price performance&#160; This allocation ties incentives to long-term
value creation. Executives are awarded (i)&nbsp;Performance Units, the value of
which is linked to improving the performance of existing assets; (ii)&nbsp;Restricted
Stock Units, which will not vest unless certain stock performance criteria are
met, and (iii)&nbsp;Stock Options. &#160;In
each case vesting of the awards is also conditioned on the recipient continuing
to be employed by AES on the vesting date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">LTC Awards (&#147;LTCAs&#148;)
under the LTC Plan will contain stock-based awards and Performance Units,
in percentages based on competitive market pay levels for each job category and
an individual&#146;s specific job performance and the Compensation Committee&#146;s
recommendations.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="PerformanceUnits_043421"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Performance Units</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Performance
Units were granted to named executive officers in 2005 pursuant to the terms of
the 2003 LTC Plan. These grants will vest one third per year on each of February&nbsp;2006,
February&nbsp;2007, February&nbsp;2008 if the holder continues to be employed
by AES on each such date. Performance Units will have an initial value of $1,
and will be valued at the end of the performance period (three years) from $0
to $2.00, depending on the achievement of stated performance goals. If the
Company achieves target performance, each performance unit is worth $1.00; if
the Company achieves less than 90% of the target performance, each performance
unit will be worth $0. If the Company achieves exactly 90% of the target
performance, each performance unit will be worth $0.50; if the Company achieves
120% or more of the target performance, each performance unit will be worth
$2.00. For each 1% of improvement in the achievement of target performance
between 90% and 120% a performance unit&#146;s cash value will increase in value
$0.05.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Payment of
vested 2005 Performance Units will be dependent on the Company&#146;s satisfactory
performance as measured by &#147;Cash Value Added&#148; (&#147;CVA&#148;). CVA is equal to the sum
of subsidiary operating cash flow minus a charge for incremental (new) capital
used by AES businesses, adjusted for subsidiary ownership percentage. The
Company has calculated a target CVA for AES as a whole based on budget and
long-term forecasts. Potential payout of vested performance units will be
dependent upon actual performance compared to this CVA target over a three-year
period (2005-2007). While the 2005 Performance Units reach maturity at
the end of 2007, the actual cash payout for vested 2005 Performance Units
granted will not be made until the first quarter of 2008. Using CVA as a
performance measure is consistent with the Company&#146;s focus on increasing
operating and free cash flow, which is considered a significant source of
stockholder value creation, and strongly links compensation for the period with
the performance of the business during the same period. A third party
consultant was engaged to perform a series of procedures to assist management
and the compensation committee in assessing the accuracy of the CVA
calculation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The fiscal year
2003 Performance Units reached maturity at the end of 2005 and were paid to
participants during the first quarter of 2006. The payout was based on the
Company&#146;s performance during the three-year period of 2003-2005. During
that period, the Company&#146;s performance against its CVA target was above the
predetermined target. Therefore, payout of these units was at $1.1427 per unit,
slightly above the initial value of 1.00 per unit. During the same period of
time the Company&#146;s stock price increased from $3.02 per share to $15.83 per
share, and the Company generated $5,378 M in Cash Flow from Operations. &#160;This long-term compensation payout&#151;based on
three years of exceptional Company performance is reflected in the long-term
cash compensation section of the &#147;Summary Compensation Table.&#148;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

Performance Unit Payout</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="37" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">15.83</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="31" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">424.2</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="307" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:230.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 9.5pt;text-indent:-9.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Market Capitalization (in $Billion)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">1.68</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="37" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">10.38</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="31" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">517.8</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="RestrictedStockUnits_043538"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Restricted Stock Units</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Restricted
Stock Units (&#147;RSU&#148;) are being granted to executive officers in 2005 under the
terms of the 2003 LTC Plan. These RSUs granted to executive officers will vest
one third per year in each of February&nbsp;2006, February&nbsp;2007 and February&nbsp;2008
if the holder continues to be employed at an AES business on each such date and
the following performance condition is met. Vesting can only occur and payment
will be made only if the Total Stockholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of AES stock exceeds
the TSR of the Standard and Poor&#146;s 500 (&#147;S&amp;P500&#148;) over the 2005-2007
measurement period. The S&amp;P 500 is utilized by the Compensation Committee
as the principal index of large-capitalization stocks reflective of the broad
domestic economy, and most common benchmark for institutional investors in
measuring relative performance of the broader market. If this vesting requirement
is met, the actual payout of the RSUs will occur in 2010. In situations where
the TSR of both AES and the S&amp;P 500 exhibit&nbsp;a gain over the
measurement period, the Compensation Committee under certain limited
circumstances has the discretion, but is not required, to allow the RSUs to
vest without satisfaction of the requirement that the TSR of AES stock exceed
the TSR of the S&amp;P 500.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="StockOptions_043540"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stock Options</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stock Options were
granted to executive officers in 2005 under the terms of the 2003 LTC Plan.
These stock options will vest in equal amounts over three years one third per
year in each of February&nbsp;2006, February&nbsp;2007, and February&nbsp;2008,
if the holder continues to be employed at an AES business on each such date.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="a2005LongTermCompensationAwardCom_043545"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">2005 Long Term
Compensation Award Components</font></b></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Company
anticipates that it will continue to award Performance Units, Restricted Stock
Units and Stock Options&#160; each year. Any
payout under such annual Performance Units will occur three years after the
date of the grant and will be contingent upon a specific three year performance
target being met at the end of the three year performance period (the three
year target being set at the time of the grant of the annual Performance Units
award.) Any payout under such annual Restricted Stock Units will occur five
years after the date of grant and will be contingent upon a specific
performance target being met.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES awards
long-term compensation in the same split between Performance Units, Restricted
Stock Units, and Stock Options to all AES people covered by the 2003 LTC Plan.
For 2005 this is estimated to be about 2,200 AES people in 17 countries. The
Company considers this broad-based LTC Plan to be an attractive element to
retain and motivate AES people throughout the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="TheAesCorporationPerformanceIncen_043839"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The AES Corporation Performance Incentive
Plan</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Company
sponsors and maintains the AES Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;Incentive Plan&#148;),
an annual incentive bonus program designed to provide incentives to key
employees with significant responsibility for achieving performance goals
critical to the success and growth of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In light of
recent changes to the Code, including The American Jobs Creation Act of 2004,
and to further enhance the provisions of the Incentive Plan, the Company has
determined that it is advisable to codify the Incentive Plan to ensure clarity
and avoid any subsequent questions regarding the past or future intent of the
Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Incentive
Plan rewards key employees with significant responsibility for achieving
performance goals critical to the success and growth of the Company. The Plan
is designed to: (i)&nbsp;promote the attainment of the Company&#146;s significant
business objectives; (ii)&nbsp;encourage and reward management teamwork across
the entire Company; and (iii)&nbsp;assist in the attraction and retention of
employees vital to the Company&#146;s long-term success.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amount of a
Participant&#146;s award may be based on a percentage of such Participant&#146;s salary
or such other methods as may be established by the Compensation Committee. Each
award shall be communicated to the Participant, and shall specify, among other
things, the terms and conditions of the award and the performance goals to be
achieved. Each award shall be conditioned upon the Company&#146;s achievement of one
or more performance goal(s)&nbsp;with respect to the performance measure(s)&nbsp;established
by the Compensation Committee.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">After the end
of the Performance Period, the Compensation Committee shall certify in writing
the extent to which the applicable performance goals and any other material
terms have been achieved. Subject to the provisions of the Incentive Plan, earned
Awards shall be paid in the first calendar year immediately following the end
of the Performance Period (it being the Company&#146;s intention that any such
payments will be made on or before March&nbsp;15 of such calendar year in order
to qualify for the short-term deferral exception under Section&nbsp;409A of the
Code).</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="ChiefExecutiveOfficerCompensation_043913"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Chief Executive Officer Compensation</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&#146;s
compensation was reviewed and approved by the Compensation Committee utilizing
the guidelines discussed above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The following factors were considered in
setting Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&#146;s compensation:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Achieved Operating Cash
Flow of&nbsp; $2,165,000;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Achieved adjusted earnings
per share of $0.91 compared to $0.59 in 2004;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Improved Safety Performance
throughout the Company in 2005;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>A continuation of the trend
of performance improvement since 2003;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Reorganized the business
into four regional units;</p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Achieved significant
financing milestone for a&#160; 670MW
coal-fired generation facility in Bulgaria;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Earnings were restated for
2002-2004;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>No permit had yet been
obtained at year end for the Ocean Cay LNG terminal in the Bahamas.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Based on the
factors listed above, the Committee determined that Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan should
receive cash compensation, which includes a base salary of $903,000 a cash bonus
of $1,551,000 for 2005 that was paid in March&nbsp;2006. In February&nbsp;2006,
the Committee determined that Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan should receive Long-Term
Compensation valued at the time of grant at $4,800,000 which includes 2,400,000
Performance Units, 152,672 Stock Options, and 75,085 Restricted Stock Units. As
previously described, the value of the Performance Units is tied to the Company&#146;s
performance as measured by &#147;Cash Value Added&#148; (&#147;CVA&#148;). Vesting of Restricted
Stock Units will only occur if the Total Stockholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of AES
Stock exceeds the TSR of the Standard and Poor&#146;s (&#147;S&amp;P 500&#148;) over the
measurement period, 2006-2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Philip A.
Odeen, Chairman<br>
Kristina M. Johnson<br>
<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Charles O. Rossotti</font></font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">24</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\fc\94175312906_D11624_997952\7856-1-ce.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:53 2006' -->

 <tr>
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><a name="CompensationOfExecutiveOfficers_135719"></a><font size="3" style="font-size:12.0pt;">COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The following
table discloses compensation received by the Chief Executive Officer and the
next four most highly compensated executive officers of the Company (the &#147;named
executive officers&#148;) for years 2003, 2004, and 2005. In addition to the
compensation described in this table, each of the named executive officers
received Performance Unit Grants in 2004 and 2005. The value of these grants is
tied to the Company&#146;s performance as measured by Cash Value Added. These awards
are described in further detail in the table entitled &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Performance Unit Awards in 2004 and 2005.</font></b>&#148;</font></p>

  <td width="41" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:30.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">73,616</font></p>

</div>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Bonuses are typically paid in the first
quarter following the year in which they are earned. By example, the bonuses
earned in 2005 were paid in March&nbsp;2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Included in this amount is Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&#146;s
personal use of Company vehicles and drivers in an amount of $14,075.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Please refer to the Table entitled &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Restricted Stock Unit Grants in 2004 and 2005&#148;</font></b>
for further details.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">These units were awarded in 2003 and had
an initial value of $1.00 per unit and a final value of $1.1427 per unit. AES
stock price rose from $3.02 to $15.83 during the same period. Please refer to
the &#147;Long-Term Compensation&#148; section of the Compensation Committee Report for
additional information.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">25</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\fc\93144124974_D11624_993771\7856-1-cg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  3 14:42 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">This column constitutes Company
contributions to The AES Corporation Retirement Savings Plan and allocations to
the Company&#146;s Restoration Supplemental Retirement Plan. Specifically for 2005, (a)&nbsp;amounts
contributed to The AES Corporation Retirement Savings Plan: Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$33,600;
Mr.&nbsp;Sharp&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$33,600; Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$33,600; Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$33,600
and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$31,288; and (b)&nbsp;amounts allocated to
the Restoration Retirement Plan: Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$184,542; Mr.&nbsp;Sharp&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$67,600;
Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$35,300; Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$61,500;
and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$46,950.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As previously announced by the Company, on
January&nbsp;20, 2006, Victoria D. Harker replaced Barry J. Sharp as Chief
Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Company announced on March&nbsp;2,
2006 that Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello is leaving the Company as of March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill
rejoined the Company as an executive officer February&nbsp;4, 2004. Prior to
that, for approximately seven years, he served as a member of the Board of
Directors of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="StockOptionGrantsIn2005_134156"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stock Option
Grants in 2005</font></b></p>

options granted for 2005 to the named executive officers of the Company.</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">All options are for shares of Common Stock
of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Percentages are based on the total number
of participants awarded options in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Assumptions the Company used to determine
the fair value of the award on the date the award was granted and include an
expected volatility of 53.11%, a 4.47% risk free rate of return, no dividends,
a 68.28% Black-Scholes ratio, three year ratable vesting, and a $11.48
post-vested Black-Scholes value. No adjustments were made for
non-transferability or risk of forfeiture. Stock option grants have a 10-year
term and vest over three years in three equal installments: one-third on the
first anniversary of the date of the grant, one-third on the second anniversary
</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\fc\93144124974_D11624_993771\7856-1-cg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  3 14:42 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">date of the grant,
and one-third on the third anniversary of the date of grant if the holder
continues to be employed by an AES business on each such date. The use of such
amounts and assumptions is not intended to forecast any possible future
appreciation of the Company&#146;s stock price or dividend policy.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The stock option grants described in the
table were awarded in February&nbsp;2005.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As previously announced by the Company, on
January&nbsp;20, 2006, Victoria D. Harker replaced Barry J. Sharp as Chief
Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Company announced on March&nbsp;2,
2006 that Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello is leaving the Company as of March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Unless terminated earlier if holder leaves the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="RestrictedStockUnitGrantsIn2004An_140009"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Restricted Stock Unit Grants in 2004 and 2005</font></b></p>

  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="50" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:37.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">467,498 </font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.9pt;">

</div>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">This Restricted Stock Unit (&#147;RSU&#148;) award
was granted on February&nbsp;4, 2004 pursuant to The AES Corporation 2003 Long
Term Compensation Plan and will vest in three equal installments beginning February&nbsp;4,
2005, February&nbsp;4, 2006, and February&nbsp;4, 2007 if certain continuing
employment and performance conditions are satisfied. The performance condition
states that the RSUs will vest if the Total Shareholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of AES
Common stock exceeds the TSR of the Standard and Poor&#146;s (&#147;S&amp;P 500&#148;) over
the measurement period, 2004-2006. If both vesting conditions are met,
the actual payout of the Restricted Stock Units will occur in 2009. In
situations where the TSR of both AES and the S&amp;P 500 exhibit a gain over
the measurement period, the Compensation Committee under certain limited
circumstances has the discretion, but is not required, to allow the </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\93144124974_D11624_993771\7856-1-cg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  3 14:42 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">RSUs to vest without
satisfaction of the measurement that the TSR of AES Common stock exceed the TSR
of the S&amp;P 500.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">This Restricted Stock Unit (&#147;RSU&#148;) award
was granted on February&nbsp;25, 2005 pursuant to The AES Corporation 2003 Long
Term Compensation Plan and will vest in three equal installments on February&nbsp;25,
2006, February&nbsp;25, 2007, and February&nbsp;25, 2008 if certain continuing
employment and performance conditions are satisfied. The performance condition
states that the RSUs will vest if the Total Shareholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of AES
Common stock exceeds the TSR of the Standard and Poor&#146;s (&#147;S&amp;P 500&#148;) over
the measurement period, 2005-2007. If both vesting conditions are met,
the actual payout of the Restricted Stock Units will occur in 2010. In
situations where the TSR of both AES and the S&amp;P 500 exhibit a gain over
the measurement period, the Compensation Committee under certain limited
circumstances has the discretion, but is not required, to allow the RSUs to
vest without satisfaction of the measurement that the TSR of AES Common stock
exceed the TSR of the S&amp;P 500.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Fair value of AES Common stock on the date
of grant was $8.97. The fair value of AES Common stock on December&nbsp;31,
2004 was $13.67 with the corresponding value on such date of the RSUs for the
named Executive Officers being as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1,885,913;
Mr.&nbsp;Sharp&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$764,837; Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$674,738; Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$628,642;
and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$712,453.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Fair value of AES Common stock on the date
of grant was $16.81. The fair value of AES Common stock on December&nbsp;31,
2005 was $15.83 with the corresponding value on such date of the RSUs for the
named Executive Officers being as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1,165,341;
Mr.&nbsp;Sharp&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$492,044; Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$414,350; Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$388,452;
and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$388,452.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As previously announced by the Company, on
January&nbsp;20, 2006 Victoria D. Harker replaced Barry J. Sharp as Chief
Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Company announced on March&nbsp;2,
2006 that Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello is leaving the Company as of March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Based on a closing price of AES Common
stock on December&nbsp;31, 2005 of $15.83.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As of May&nbsp;4, 2005, Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi was appointed
Executive Vice President for Business Development and Strategy. Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi
received a retention grant of 59,079 RSUs under The AES Corporation 2003 Long
Term Compensation Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). The grant is scheduled to vest one third
per year for three years provided that Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi is employed by an AES
business on each such vesting date and will be paid out in accordance with
terms determined by the Board of Directors pursuant to the Plan. Fair value of
AES Common stock on the date of grant was $16.08. The fair value of AES Common
stock on December&nbsp;31, 2005 was $15.83.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="50" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:37.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.95pt;">

</table>

</div>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The amounts in this column have been
calculated based on the difference between the quoted market closing price of
the Company&#146;s Common Stock on December&nbsp;31, 2005 of $15.83 per share for
each security underlying such stock option and the per share exercise price.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As previously announced by the Company, on
January&nbsp;20, 2006, Victoria D. Harker replaced Barry J. Sharp as Chief
Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Company announced on March&nbsp;2, 2006 that Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello
is leaving the Company as of March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">29</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="50" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:37.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.0pt;">
