  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Awarded in February&nbsp;2005, 2008 payout
if vesting conditions are satisfied.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Awarded in February&nbsp;2004, 2007 payout
if vesting conditions are satisfied.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Performance Units granted under the terms
of The 2003 Long Term Compensation Plan are paid in cash and will have an
initial value of $1, and will be valued at the end of the performance period
(three years) from $0 to $2.00, depending on the achievement of stated
performance goals. (If target performance is achieved, each performance unit is
worth $1.00; if the participant achieves less than 90% of the target
performance, each performance unit will be worth $0; if the participant
achieves 120% or more of the target performance, each performance unit will be
worth $2.00.) For each 1% of improvement in the achievement of the target
performance between 90% and 120%, a Performance Units cash value will increase
in value $.05. The value of the 2005 Performance Units will be tied to the
Company&#146;s performance as measured by &#147;Cash Value Added&#148; (&#147;CVA&#148;). CVA is equal
to the sum of subsidiary operating cash flow minus a charge for incremental
(new) capital used by AES businesses, adjusted for subsidiary ownership
percentage. The Company has calculated a target CVA for AES as a whole based on
budget and long-term forecasts. A participant payout of 2005 vested performance
units will be dependent upon actual performance compared to this CVA target
over the 2005-2008 period. A participant&#146;s pay out of 2004 vested
performance units will be dependent upon actual performance compared to the CVA
target over the 2004-2007 period.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">As previously announced by the Company, on
January&nbsp;20, 2006, Victoria D. Harker replaced Barry J. Sharp as Chief
Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Company announced on March&nbsp;2, 2006 that Mr.&nbsp;Ruggirello
is leaving the Company as of March&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><a name="Proposal3ProposalToAdoptTheAesCor_054935"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="608" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:456.35pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">PROPOSAL 3: PROPOSAL TO ADOPT </font><font size="2" style="font-size:11.0pt;">THE AES<br>
  CORPORATION PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE PLAN</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Board of
Directors proposes that Stockholders approve the adoption of The AES
Corporation Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;Incentive Plan&#148;). The Incentive
Plan provides cash incentives to key employees with significant responsibility
for achieving performance goals critical to the success and growth of the
Company. &#160;In light of recent changes to
the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Code&#148;), including The American Jobs Creation
Act of 2004, and to further enhance the provisions of the Incentive Plan, the
Company has determined that it is advisable to formalize and codify the
Incentive Plan to ensure clarity and avoid any subsequent questions regarding
the past or future intent of the Incentive Plan. The Board adopted the
Incentive Plan on December&nbsp;9, 2005, subject to the approval of the Company&#146;s
Stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The more
significant features of the Plan are described below. This summary is subject,
in all respects to the terms of the Plan, which is attached to this Proxy
Statement as Exhibit&nbsp;2.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Administration</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Incentive
Plan shall be administered by the Compensation Committee (the &#147;Committee&#148;) of
the Board of Directors; provided, however, that all acts and authority of the
Committee pursuant to this Incentive Plan shall be subject to the provisions of
the Committee&#146;s Charter, as amended from time to time, and such other authority
as may be delegated to the Committee by the Board.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Eligibility</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Officers and
key employees of the Company shall be eligible to participate in the Incentive
Plan. No employee shall have the right to participate in the Incentive Plan,
and participation in the Incentive Plan in any one Performance Period does not
entitle an individual to participate in future Performance Periods.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Awards</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Committee
may, in its discretion, from time to time make awards to persons eligible for
participation in the Incentive Plan pursuant to which the Participant will earn
cash compensation. The amount of a Participant&#146;s award may be based on a
percentage of such Participant&#146;s salary or such other methods as may be
established by the Committee. Each award shall be communicated to the
Participant, and shall specify, among other things, the terms and conditions of
the award and the Performance Goals to be achieved. The maximum amount of an
award that may be earned under the Incentive Plan by any Participant for any
Performance Period shall not exceed USD
$5,000,000. With respect to awards that are intended to be
performance-based compensation under Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the Code, each
award shall be conditioned upon the Company&#146;s achievement of one or more
Performance Goal(s)&nbsp;with respect to the Performance Measure(s)&nbsp;established
by the Committee. No later than ninety (90) days after the beginning of the
applicable Performance Period, the Committee shall establish in writing the
Performance Goals, Performance Measures and the method(s)&nbsp;for computing
the amount of compensation which will be payable under the Incentive Plan to
each Participant if the Performance Goals established by the Committee are
attained; provided however, that for a Performance Period of less than one
year, the Committee shall take any such actions prior to the lapse of 25% of
the Performance Period. In addition to establishing minimum Performance Goals
below which no compensation shall be payable pursuant to an award, the
Committee, in its discretion, may create a performance schedule under which an
amount less than or more than the target award may be paid so long as the
Performance Goals have been achieved.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Distribution of
Awards</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">After the end
of the Performance Period, the Committee shall certify in writing the extent to
which the applicable Performance Goals and any other material terms have been
achieved. Subject to the provisions of the Incentive Plan, earned Awards shall
be paid in the first calendar year immediately following the end of the
Performance Period (it being the Company&#146;s intention that any such payments
will be made on or before March&nbsp;15 of such calendar year in order to
qualify for the short-term deferral exception under Section&nbsp;409A of the
Code). For purposes of this provision, and for so long as the Code permits, the
approved minutes of the Committee meeting in which the certification is made
may be treated as written certification.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Transferability</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A Participant&#146;s
rights under the Incentive Plan may not be assigned, pledged, or otherwise
transferred except, in the event of a Participant&#146;s death, to the Participant&#146;s
designated beneficiary, or in the absence of such a designation, by will or by
the laws of descent and distribution.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Termination of
Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Committee
may at any time (without the consent of the Participant) modify, amend or
terminate any or all of the provisions of this Incentive Plan to the extent
necessary to conform to the provisions of the Incentive Plan with Section&nbsp;409A
or Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the Code or the regulations promulgated
thereunder regardless of whether such modification, amendment, or termination
of the Incentive Plan shall adversely affect the rights of a Participant under
the Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Board of
Directors recommends that the Stockholders adopt the Company&#146;s Incentive Plan
and intends to introduce at the forthcoming Annual Meeting the following
resolution (designated herein as Proposal 3):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 30.0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">&#147;RESOLVED, that
the Stockholders of the Company hereby adopt The AES Corporation Performance
Incentive Plan as described herein and provided in its entirety as Exhibit&nbsp;2.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The affirmative vote of Stockholders
representing a majority of the outstanding shares of Common Stock is necessary
for the adoption of Proposal 3.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="border:solid black 1.0pt;padding:6.0pt .7pt 6.0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="TheBoardOfDirectorsRecommendsAVot_055109"></a><b><font style="font-weight:bold;">THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE<i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i><u>FOR</u><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i>THE ADOPTION OF THE AES CORPORATION PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE
  PLAN (THE &#147;INCENTIVE PLAN&#148;)</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><a name="EmploymentAgreementsSeparationAgr_055319"></a><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><a name="EmploymentAgreementsSeparationAgr_055346"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="608" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:456.35pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:3.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">EMPLOYMENT
  AGREEMENTS, SEPARATION AGREMENTS<br>
  AND CHANGE IN CONTROL AGREEMENTS</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Company has
individual employment agreements with Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan, Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill and Ms.&nbsp;Harker
(the &#147;Employment Agreements&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Each of the
Employment Agreements are one-year agreements, which are scheduled to expire on
December&nbsp;31, 2007, provided, however, that on January&nbsp;1, 2007, and on
each subsequent January&nbsp;1, the term of the Employment Agreements shall
automatically be renewed and extended for one additional year unless, no later
than the date which is six (6)&nbsp;months prior to the renewal date, the
Company or the individual provides notice of an intent not to extend the term
of the Agreement(s). Each of the Employment Agreements provides a respective
base salary amount. In 2005, the base salary amounts for the respective Employment
Agreements were as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&nbsp;-&nbsp;$871,000; Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill&nbsp;-&nbsp;$470,000
and Ms.&nbsp;Harker&nbsp;-&nbsp;$500,000 (effective January&nbsp;23, 2006). Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan
also is eligible for an annual bonus with a target of (150%) of his base
salary; Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill and Ms.&nbsp;Harker are eligible for an annual bonus
with a target of (105%) of their respective base salary. &#160;The annual bonus amounts are payable based on
achievement of corporate performance goals and/or other conditions that are
established by the Compensation Committee of the Board. Each of the individuals
also is eligible to participate in the Company&#146;s long-term compensation plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Employment
Agreements provide that, if the Company terminates an executive&#146;s employment
other than for Disability or Cause or if an individual terminates his
employment for Good Reason, as each such term is defined in the Employment
Agreements, then the Company will be obligated to pay the terminated individual
a pro rata bonus for the year of termination and (a)&nbsp;if the terminated
individual is Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill or Ms.&nbsp;Harker, an amount equal to the
product of one (1)&nbsp;and the sum of the annual Base Salary rate in effect
for the individual immediately preceding the date of termination and the
individual&#146;s target bonus for the year in which the date of termination occurs
or (b)&nbsp;if the terminated individual is Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan, an amount equal
to the product of two (2)&nbsp;and the sum of (i)&nbsp;the annual Base Salary
rate in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan immediately preceding the date of
termination and (ii)&nbsp;his target bonus for the year in which the date of
termination occurs. In addition, each of Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill and Ms.&nbsp;Harker
would be entitled, for a twelve (12)&nbsp;month period immediately following
the date of termination, with Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan entitled to a twenty-four
(24)&nbsp;month period, to continue to participate in all medical, dental,
hospitalization, life insurance and other welfare, fringe benefit and
perquisite plans and programs, in each case in which he was participating on
the date of termination. Each option to acquire Common Stock of the Company
granted under a Company incentive plan or other arrangement that is held by the
individual on the date of termination would remain outstanding, and continue to
vest according to its terms as if the individual remained employed by the
Company, until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the end of the original term of such
option or (ii), if the terminated individual is Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill, the second
anniversary of the date of termination, or (iii), if the terminated individual
is Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan, the third anniversary of the date of termination.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">If an Executive&#146;s
Employment Agreement is terminated by the Company other than for Cause or
Disability or if the Executive terminates his Employment for Good Reason, in
either case within two years following a Change in Control, the terminated
Executive shall receive the payments and benefits set forth above regarding
termination by an individual for Good Reason or by the Company other than for
Disability or Cause, except that (i)&nbsp;for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill,
the multiplier regarding the product of the sum of the annual base salary and
annual target bonus shall be increased to three (3)&nbsp;and for Ms.&nbsp;Harker
shall be increased to two (2); </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(ii)&nbsp;the
benefit continuation period for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill shall
be extended to thirty-six (36)&nbsp;months; and (iii)&nbsp;for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan
and Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill, each option described above held by the employee shall
vest and become immediately exercisable in full on the date of termination and
shall remain exercisable until the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the end of the original
term of such option or (b)&nbsp;the fourth anniversary of the date of
termination of the respective Employment Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">For purposes of
the Employment Agreements, &#147;Change in Control&#148; shall mean the occurrence of any
one of the following events: (a)&nbsp;any Person is or becomes the Beneficial
Owner of securities of the Company representing 30% or more of the combined
voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities; (b)&nbsp;the
following individuals cease for any reason to constitute a majority of
Directors then serving: individuals who, on the date hereof, constitute the
Board and any new Director whose appointment or election by the Board or
nomination for election by the Company&#146;s Stockholders was approved or recommended
by a vote of at least two-thirds (</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;"> 2</font><font face="Symbol">&#164;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:2.0pt;">3</font>) of the Directors then still in office
who either were Directors on the date hereof or whose appointment, election or
nomination for election was previously so approved or recommended; or (c)&nbsp;there
is consummated a merger or consolidation of the Company or any direct or
indirect subsidiary of the Company with any other corporation, other than (i)&nbsp;a
merger or consolidation immediately following which the individuals who
comprise the Board immediately prior thereto constitute at least a majority of
the Board of the entity surviving such merger or consolidation or any parent
thereof, or (ii)&nbsp;a merger or consolidation effected to implement a
recapitalization of the Company; or (d)&nbsp;the Stockholders of the Company
approve a plan of complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company or there
is consummated an agreement for the sale or disposition by the Company of all
or substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets.</p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><a name="TheAesCorporationPeerGroupIndexst_055521"></a><a name="ComparisonOf5YearCumulativeTotalR_055541"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="608" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:456.35pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:3.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">THE AES
  CORPORATION<br>
  PEER GROUP INDEX/STOCK PRICE PERFORMANCE</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 21.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 35.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">COMPARISON OF 5 YEAR CUMULATIVE TOTAL RETURNS<br>
ASSUMES INITIAL INVESTMENT OF $100<br><img width="503" height="207" src="g78561cii001.jpg" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ComparisonOf3YearCumulativeTotalR_143447"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">COMPARISON OF 3 YEAR CUMULATIVE TOTAL RETURNS<br>
ASSUMES INITIAL INVESTMENT OF $100<br><img width="503" height="207" src="g78561cii002.jpg" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></b></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">35</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 26.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ComparisonOf1YearCumulativeTotalR_055550"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">COMPARISON OF 1 YEAR CUMULATIVE TOTAL RETURN<br>
ASSUMES INITIAL INVESTMENT OF $100<br><img width="507" height="207" src="g78561cii003.jpg" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES has
selected the Standard and Poor&#146;s (S&amp;P) 500 Utilities Index as its peer
group index, effective this year. The S&amp;P 500 Utilities Index is a
published sector index comprising the 32 electric and gas utilities included in
the S&amp;P 500. Previously, AES had selected the S&amp;P 500 Multi-Utilities
Index as its peer group index. This was one of several sub-groups under the
S&amp;P 500 Utilities Index.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">However in
April, 2005 S&amp;P restructured the S&amp;P 500 Utilities Index sub-industry
indices. In doing so, it moved AES to a newly-created S&amp;P 500 Independent
Power Producers&nbsp;&amp; Energy Traders Index. This index has only five
members and does not have historical return information available. AES believes
that using the S&amp;P 500 Multi-Utilities Index is no longer appropriate,
since AES is not included in that Index. Instead, the broader S&amp;P Utilities
Index, which includes a broader range of companies that operate in the type of
businesses operated by AES, is the most appropriate peer index within the
S&amp;P 500 Index.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The total
return charts above assumes $100 invested in December&nbsp;31 of the start year
in AES Common Stock, the S&amp;P 500 Index, the S&amp;P Multi-Utilities Index
(the former peer group), and the S&amp;P Utilities Index (the new peer group)
for five-year, three-year and one-year periods.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">36</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><a name="GovernanceMatters_142739"></a><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="608" style="background:#EBEBEB;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:456.35pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:3.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">GOVERNANCE
  MATTERS</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="StockholderProposalsAndNomination_142602"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stockholder Proposals and Nominations for
Director</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Any Stockholder entitled to vote in the
election of Directors and who meets the requirements of the Proxy rules&nbsp;under
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 may submit proposals to be considered by
the Board for submission to the Stockholders at the Year 2007 Annual Meeting.
Any such proposal must be submitted in writing by notice delivered or mailed by
first-class United States mail, postage prepaid to the Secretary, The AES
Corporation, 4300 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia 22203. Any such
proposal must be received no later than December&nbsp;1, 2006 in compliance
with Rule&nbsp;14a-8 of the Exchange Act. Any such notice must set forth:
(a)&nbsp;the name and address of the Stockholder and the text of the proposal
to be introduced; (b)&nbsp;the number of shares of Common Stock held of record,
owned beneficially and represented by Proxy by such Stockholder as of the date
of such notice; and (c)&nbsp;a representation that the Stockholder intends to
appear in person or by Proxy at the Annual Meeting to introduce the proposal
specified in the notice. The chairperson of the Annual Meeting may refuse to
acknowledge the introduction of any Stockholder proposal not made in compliance
with the foregoing procedure.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES&#146; By-laws
also contain a procedure for Stockholder nomination of Directors. The By-laws
provide that any record owner of Common Stock entitled to be voted generally in
the election of Directors may nominate one or more persons for election as a
Director at a Stockholders meeting. Written notice must be given to the
Secretary of AES describing the intent for making such nomination. &#160;The notice must be given, with respect to an
Annual Meeting, no later than 90 days in advance of such Annual Meeting and
with respect to a special meeting, no later than the close of business on the
seventh day following the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the date on which notice of such
special meeting is first given to Stockholders and (b)&nbsp;the date on which a
public announcement of such meeting is first made. Each notice must include (i)&nbsp;the
name and address of each Stockholder who intends to appear in person or by
Proxy to make the nomination of the person or persons to be nominated; (ii)&nbsp;a
description of all arrangements or understandings between the Stockholder and
each Nominee and any other person or persons (naming them) pursuant to which
the nomination is to be made by the Stockholder; (iii)&nbsp;such other
information regarding each Nominee proposed by such Stockholder as would have
been included in a proxy statement filed pursuant to Rule&nbsp;14a-8
under the Exchange Act; and (iv)&nbsp;the consent of each Nominee to serve if
elected. The presiding officer of the meeting may refuse to acknowledge the
nomination of any person not made in compliance with the above described
procedure.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="AesCodeOfBusinessConductAndEthics_055730"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES Code of
Business Conduct and Ethics and Corporate Governance Guidelines</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A Code of
Business Conduct and Ethics (&#147;Code of Conduct&#148;) and Corporate Governance
Guidelines have been adopted by the Board. The Code of Conduct is intended to
govern as a requirement of employment the actions of everyone who works at AES,
including employees of AES subsidiaries and affiliates. The Code of Conduct and
the Corporate Governance Guidelines are located in their entirety on the
Company&#146;s web site (www.aes.com). Any person may obtain a copy of the Code of
Conduct or the Corporate Governance Guidelines without charge by making a
written request to: Corporate Secretary, The AES Corporation, 4300 Wilson
Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22203.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Section16abeneficialOwnershipRepo_055736"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial
Ownership Reporting Compliance</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Based solely on
the Company&#146;s review of reports filed under Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the
Exchange Act and certain written representations (as allowed by Item 405(b)(2)(i)&nbsp;of
Regulation&nbsp;S-K), the Company believes that no person subject to Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of
the Exchange Act with respect to the registrant failed to file on a timely
basis </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">37</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\fc\94172641967_D11854_997906\7856-1-ci.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  4 17:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">the reports
required by Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act during the most recent
fiscal year except for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan who in 2005 received a deferred award
of 3,946 units as a result of an administrative correction affecting his
supplemental retirement plan account balances for years 1998 and 1999 and
therefore did not timely report such award on Form&nbsp;5, Mr.&nbsp;Hemphill
who did not timely report the award of 48 deferred units on Form&nbsp;4, and Mr.&nbsp;McArthur
who did not timely report the award of 6,051 deferred units on Form&nbsp;4.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="CharitableContributions_055744"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Charitable
Contributions</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Under NYSE
303A.02 (b)&nbsp;(v), the Company is required to report as to whether or not
any charitable contributions were made by the Company to any charitable
organization for which an AES Director served as an executive officer of that
organization in an amount greater than $1&nbsp;million or 2% of such charitable
organization&#146;s consolidated gross revenues for year 2005, 2004, or 2003. The
Company did not make any such charitable contributions.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="CommunicationsWithTheBoardOrItsCo_055752"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Communications
with the Board or Its Committees</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Board
offers several e-mail addresses as set forth below for Stockholders to send
communications through the Secretary of the Company to the non-management
Directors and/or the four standing committees of the Board:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES Board of
Directors: <u>AESDirectors@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Financial Audit
Committee:<br>
<u>AuditCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Compensation
Committee:<br>
<u>CompCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Nominating and
Corporate Governance Committee:<br>
<u>NomGovCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Environment,
Safety and Technology Committee:<br>
<u>ESTCommitteeChair@aes.com</u><i><font style="font-style:italic;"> </font></i></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Secretary
will forward to the Directors all communications that, in his or her judgment,
are appropriate for consideration by the Directors. Examples of communications
that would not be considered as appropriate for consideration by the Directors
include commercial solicitations, requests for employment and matters not
relevant to the Stockholders, to the functioning of the Board or to the affairs
of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Form10kAnnualReport_055933"></a><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Form&nbsp;10-K
Annual Report</font></u></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Any
Stockholder who desires an additional copy of the Company&#146;s 2005 Annual Report
on Form&nbsp;10-K filed on or about April&nbsp;4, 2006 with the Securities
and Exchange Commission may obtain a copy (excluding exhibits) without charge
by addressing a request to the Secretary, The AES Corporation, 4300 Wilson
Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia 22203. Exhibits also may be requested, but a
charge equal to the reproduction cost thereof will be made. Stockholders may
also obtain a copy by visiting the Company&#146;s web site at http://www.aes.com.</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">By Order of the Board of Directors,</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Brian A. Miller<br>
Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary</font></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="DirectionsToAnnualMeeting4300Wils_055954"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">DIRECTIONS TO
ANNUAL MEETING (4300 WILSON BOULEVARD, ARLINGTON, VA 22203):</font></b></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From
Points North</font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">&#151;I-270
SPUR S toward I-495 S/Northern Virginia; merge onto Capital Beltway/I-495
S; Merge onto VA-267 E via Exit 45B on the LEFT toward I-66
E/Washington; VA-267 E becomes I-66E; take the Fairfax Drive exit
(Exit 71). Turn RIGHT onto Glebe Road; turn LEFT onto Wilson Boulevard. The AES
offices are located in the building on RIGHT after turning onto Wilson
Boulevard.</font></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From

N to I-395 N toward Washington; Merge onto S Glebe Road/VA-120 N
via Exit 7B toward Marymount University; turn RIGHT onto Wilson Boulevard; End
at the AES offices located at 4300 Wilson Boulevard.</font></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From
